intro: Orthopenthea schizodioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed orthopenthea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in late spring to early summer. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations to high-altitude environments.
